articles.title: UK and Europe Heat Wave News: Live Updates
articles.description: Hours after breaking a record, Britain recorded a temperature of 40.2 degrees Celsius (104.4 Fahrenheit). If confirmed, it would be the highest temperature ever in the United Kingdom — but the day was far from over.
articles.content: LONDON By Monday afternoon, temperatures had reached 34 degrees Celsius (94 Fahrenheit) in north London, but residents were anxiously looking ahead to Tuesday, when it was forecast to be even hotter.… [+3589 chars]

articles.title: 'Heat apocalypse': Photos show Europe's devastating wildfires as temperatures surge
articles.description: Heat records have been broken across Western Europe, with Britain recording its hottest-ever day as temperatures hit 102.4 degrees Fahrenheit.
articles.content:
Dubbed a "heat apocalypse" by one French meteorologist, many nations in Europe are sweltering under record temperatures, causing devastating wildfires in some parts of the continent.
